studyTitle: Cut Calories, Lengthen Life Span? Randomized Trial Uncovers Evidence That Calorie Restriction Might Slow Aging, but Questions Remain.
author: Rita Rubin.
primaryOutcomeResults: Calorie restriction resulted in an average weight loss of 7.7 kg (17 lbs) compared to a 0.4 kg (0.9 lbs) weight loss in the usual diet group
conclusion: Calorie restriction resulted in significantly more weight loss than a usual diet.
gPTSummary: This was a 2-year clinical trial of 218 participants that compared the effects of calorie restriction versus a usual diet on body weight. Unspecified blinding was used. Calorie restriction resulted in an average weight loss of 7.7 kg (17 lbs) compared to a 0.4 kg (0.9 lbs) weight loss in the usual diet group, indicating that calorie restriction is a more effective way to lose weight.
